sense.def:
To shake someone or something
pomeni nekoga ali nekaj hitro premikati naprej in nazaj ali gor in dol.

seg.quote: He awakened to find himself being shaken roughly by his father.
The wind shook white petals from the tree.
She gave her skirts a vigorous shake.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
shakes
, se s hitrimi in kratkimi premiki prestavlja v eno in drugo stran ali navzgor in navzdol.

seg.quote: The earth shook and the sky darkened.

sense.def:
Kadar glas nekega človeka
is shaking
, tisti človek ne more obvladati svojega glasu, ker je živčen ali jezen.

seg.quote: His eyes were wild and his voice shook.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
shakes someone
, človeka presune in vznemiri.

seg.quote: My mother's death had shaken him dreadfully.
I was badly shaken. I had never had a crash before.

sense.def:
To shake hands with someone
ali
to shake someone's hand
pomeni seči nekomu v roko ob srečanju ali slovesu, pri čestitanju ali v znak prijateljstva.

seg.quote: Elijah and I shook hands and said good night.

sense.def:
To shake one's head
pomeni premikati glavo v levo in desno in tako izraziti zanikanje.

To shake off someone or something
pomeni, da neki osebi uspe uiti ali se znebiti tistega človeka ali stvari, ki ji je v nadlego.

seg.quote: It had taken Franklin several hours to shake off the police.
